    • Constructor Detail

      • AsyncThread

        public AsyncThread(TAPJob j,
           ADQLExecutor executor,
           ServiceErrorWriter errorWriter)
            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Build a TAP asynchronous job execution.
        Parameters:
        j - Description of the job to execute.
        executor - The object to use for the ADQL execution itself.
        errorWriter - The object to use to format and to write an execution error for the user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the job parameter or the ADQLExecutor is missing.

    • Method Detail

      • isReadyForExecution

        public final boolean isReadyForExecution()

        Check whether this thread is able to start right now.

        Basically, this function asks to the ADQLExecutor to get a database connection. If no DB connection is available, then this thread can not start and this function return FALSE. In all the other cases, TRUE is returned.

        Warning: This function will indirectly open and keep a database connection, so that the job can be started just after its call. If it turns out that the execution won't start just after this call, the DB connection should be closed in some way in order to save database resources.

        Returns:
        true if this thread can start right now, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.0

      • jobWork

        protected void jobWork()
                throws UWSException,
                       java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: JobThread

        Does the job work (i.e. making a long computation or executing a query on a Database).

        Important:

        • This method does the job work but it MUST also fill the associated job with the execution results and/or errors.
        • Do not forget to check the interrupted flag of the thread (Thread.isInterrupted()) and then to send an InterruptedException. Otherwise the UWSJob.stop() method will have no effect, as for UWSJob.abort() and JobThread.setError(ErrorSummary).

        Notes:

        • The "setPhase(COMPLETED)" and the "endTime=new Date()" are automatically applied just after the call to jobWork.
        • If a UWSException is thrown the JobThread will automatically publish the exception in this job thanks to the UWSJob.error(ErrorSummary) method or the UWSJob.setErrorSummary(ErrorSummary) method, and so it will set its phase to ExecutionPhase.ERROR.
        • If an InterruptedException is thrown the JobThread will automatically set the phase to ExecutionPhase.ABORTED

        Specified by:
        jobWork in class JobThread
        Throws:
        UWSException - If there is any kind of error which must be propagated.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread has been interrupted or if any method throws this exception.

      • getTAPJob

        public final TAPJob getTAPJob()
        Get the description of the job that this thread is executing.
        Returns:
        The executed job.
